TopicTitle: Who else is a Cadet of any type?

Articles.Content:
Who else is a cadet? Such as me I'm a cadet in Civil Air Patrol (USAF AUX). Just leave what type of cadet and the name of the program.

Edited August 21, 2013 by Navyguy

I was going to sign up as a British Army Cadet when I was younger, because I'm from a military family. I never had the time to do it though, but I'm hoping to join the Royal Army Med Corps as a CMT or the Royal Regiment of Scotland as a Combat Medic next year after classes are done,
C/CMSgt, CAP. Ft. Mchenry Composite Squadron, Group II, MD.
A cadet in the New Zealand Air Training corps.
A cadet in the Dark Basement Occupation Force

A cadet in the Dark Basement Occupation Force

As are many on this forum I'd guess.

My son is in the ATC (RAF cadets) ~ been flying with them on numerous occasions.
I suppose you could call me a cadet wannabe--I intend to do ROTC for two years in college, enlist after graduating, and then go to OCS once I'm eligible.
"Cadet" in NJROTC, unit is second in the Nation currently. We only lost it last year by 12 pts, too.
